document.masterDocTitle: Description of new Chimarra (Trichoptera: Philopotamidae) species from the Solomon Islands

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of new Chimarra (Trichoptera: Philopotamidae) species from the Solomon Islands

heading.emphasis:
Key to males of
Chimarra
from the Solomon Islands

paragraph.keyLead:
1 Forewings and hind wings each with large, pale, central hyaline field (
Fig. 2
)
........................... C. maculata
sp. n.

3 ( 2 ’) Sternite IX with ventral process much longer than wide (
Fig. 16
)
............................................... C. talinensis
sp. n.

- Sternite IX with ventral process about as long as wide (
Kimmins, 1957 , fig. 5 A
)
................ C. biramosa
Kimmins

4 ( 2 ’) Inferior appendages 2 or more times longer than broad in lateral view (
Figs 21
, 26 ,
31 , 36
) .................................. 5

- Inferior appendages less than 2 times as long as broad in lateral view (
Figs 41
, 46 ,
51
) ........................................ 8

5 ( 4 ’) Segment IX strongly produced anterad, forming narrow plate in lateral view (
Figs 21
, 26 ); inferior appendages slender, nearly straight (
Figs 21
, 26 )......................................................................................................................... 6

- Segment IX only slightly produced anterad, forming broad lobes in lateral view (
Figs 31
, 36 ); inferior appendages each with basal half broad, distal half slender and bent posterad (
Fig. 31
, 36 ) ........................................................ 7

8 ( 4 ’) Tergum X forming pair of wide, setose triangular lobes in lateral and dorsal views (
Kimmins 1957 , figs 6 A, 6 B
); each lobe with 2 long, slender, up-curving processes (
Kimmins 1957 , fig. 6 A
)
.................. C. aureofusca
Kimmins

- Tergum X forming pair of slender processes in dorsal view, without lateral branches (
Figs 42
, 47 ,
52
) ................ 9

keyStep.paragraph:
projection of phallobase more than half as long as total length of phallobase (
Fig. 44
); phallobase with posteroventral apex spine-like (
Fig. 44
)
...................................................................................................... C. ventrospina
sp. n.
- Segment IX longer than high in lateral view (
Figs 46
, 51 ); inferior appendages apically pointed (
Figs 46
, 51 ); basodorsal projection of phallobase half as long as total length of phallobase, or shorter (
Figs 49
, 54 ); phallobase without spine-like ventral apex (
Figs 49
, 54 ) .......................................................................................................... 10

paragraph.keyLead:
10 ( 9 ’)Inferior appendages triangular in lateral view (
Fig. 46
).........................................................
C. solomonensis
sp. n.

- Inferior appendages nearly quadrangular in lateral view (
Fig. 51
)
.............................................. C. rosavensis
sp. n.
